nodes.whoTheyAre: Mahendra Singhi is the managing director and CEO of Dalmia Cement, a prominent cement manufacturing group in India targeting to become carbon-negative by 2040.
nodes.whyListen:
Mahendra Singhi leads Dalmia Cement, one of the most profitable and sustainable cement companies, which also has one of the lowest carbon footprints. In 2018, Dalmia Cement committed to become a carbon-negative cement group by 2040. Singhi follows the business philosophy of "clean and green is profitable and sustainable."

Singhi has 43 years of experience in the cement sector. Up until 2013, he led Shree Cement Ltd. for 20 years as one of the most efficient and profitable cement producers. He has represented the business and cement sector globally in platforms including the 2019 UN Climate Action Summit, UN Climate Ambition Summit, Global Climate Action in COP-24 and high-level dialogues with the French presidency. He serves on a range of organizations and commissions in India and abroad, including as carbon pricing champion for World Bank Group and a member of the alliance of CEO climate leaders to the World Economic Forum.

videoData.description: Cement is vital to modernizing all kinds of infrastructure in the developing world -- but manufacturing it comes at an enormous environmental cost in the form of carbon emissions. Mahendra Singhi, the CEO of one of India's largest cement producers, discusses his team's effort to transform the industry by targeting the two largest sources of CO2 emissions, with the goal of making carbon-negative cement.
